snippet: Genzyme, the American biotechnology unit of the French drug maker Sanofi, is buying a 12 percent stake in Alnylam Pharmaceuticals for $700 million as part of an expanded alliance to develop treatments for rare genetic diseases.
abstract: Genzyme, the American biotechnology unit of the French drug maker Sanofi, is buying a 12 percent stake in Alnylam Pharmaceuticals for $700 million as part of an expanded alliance to develop treatments for rare genetic diseases.

headline.main: Sanofi Unit to Buy $700 Million Stake in Rare Disease Company
